isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - HOOD, GRILLE, AND FENDERS - 5000i, 9000i - REMOVE - REMOVE MUD GUARDS

svcsubproc.title: Remove Mud Guards on 9100 i (SBA), 9200 i (SBA) and 9400 i (SBA)

figure.caption: Figure 25. Remove Mud Guards on 9100 i (SBA), 9200 i (SBA) and 9400 i (SBA)

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 25 for all items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove three hex bolts with flat washers (Items 1 and 2) and three hex nuts with lock washers (Items 3 and 4), securing the mud guard (Item 5) and mud guard reinforcement (Item 6) to the fender extension (Item 7). Remove the mud guard and mud guard reinforcement from the fender extension, driver side shown.
Repeat this procedure to remove passenger side mud guard.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Mud Guards on 9200 i (SBA) and 9400 i (SBA) with Chassis Side skirts
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 26 for all items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove four hex bolts with flat washers (Items 1 and 2) and four hex nuts with lock washers (Items 3 and 4), securing the mud guard (Item 5) and mud guard retainer plate (Item 6) to the mud guard mounting bracket (Item 7). Remove the mud guard and mud guard retainer plate from the mud guard mounting bracket, driver side shown.
Repeat this procedure to remove passenger side mud guard.

figure.caption: Figure 26. Remove Mud Guards on 9200 i (SBA) and 9400 i (SBA) with Chassis Side Skirts

svcsubproc.title: Remove Hood-Bumper Mud Guards on 9100 i (SBA), 9200 i (SBA) and 9400 i (SBA)
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 27 for all items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove two hex nuts and flat washers (Items 1 and 2), securing the hood-bumper mud guard (Item 3) to the hood-bumper mud guard weldstud plate (Item 4) located in the headlight opening (Item 5) of the hood assembly (Item 6), headlight removed for clarity, driver and passenger side shown.

figure.caption: Figure 27. Remove Hood-Bumper Mud Guards on 9100 i (SBA), 9200 i (SBA) and 9400 i (SBA)

calloutgroup.callout1: 4. HOOD-BUMPER MUD GUARD WELDSTUD MOUNTING PLATE

step1.para: Remove push-in fastener (Item 7), securing the hood-bumper mud guard (Item 3) to the underside of the hood assembly (Item 6), driver and passenger side shown.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Mud Guards on 9900 i (SFA), 9900 ix (SFA) and 5900 i (SFA)
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 28 for all items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove three pan head mach. screws with flat washers (Items 1 and 2) and hex nuts with lock washers and flat washers (Items 3, 4 and 5) securing the mud guard (Item 6) and mud guard retainer (Item 7) to the inside of the fender (Item 8). Remove the mud guard and mud guard retainer from inside the fender, driver side shown.
Repeat this procedure to remove passenger side mud guard.

figure.caption: Figure 28. Remove Mud Guards on 9900 i (SFA), 9900 ix (SFA) and 5900 i (SFA)

svcsubproc.title: Remove Hood-Bumper Mud Guards on 9900 i (SFA), 9900 ix (SFA) and 5900 i (SFA)
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 29 for all items in parentheses.

step1.para: Drill out four rivets with washers (Items 1 and 2) attaching the hood-bumper mud guard (Item 3) to the front of the hood assembly (Item 4), driver side shown.
Repeat this procedure to remove passenger side hood-bumper mud guard.

figure.caption: Figure 29. Remove Hood- Bumper Mud Guards on 9900 i (SFA), 9900 ix (SFA) and 5900 i (SFA)

svcsubproc.title: Remove Mud Guards on 5500 i (SFA) with Tilt Hood
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 20 for all items in parentheses.

step1.para: With hood tilted open, remove five hex bolts with flat washers (Items 1 and 2) and (Items 7 and 8) and five hex nuts with lock washers (Items 3 and 4) and (Items 9 and 10) securing mud guard (Item 20) and mud guard channel bracket (Item 21) to the chassis splash panel and mud guard mounting bracket (Item 6), driver side shown.
Repeat this procedure to remove passenger side mud guard.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Hood-Bumper Mud Guards on 5500 i (SFA)
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 30 for all items in parentheses.

step1.para: With hood tilted open, drill out four rivets with washers (Items 1 and 2) attaching the hood-bumper mud guard (Item 3) to the front of the hood assembly (Item 4), driver side shown.
Repeat this procedure to remove passenger side hood-bumper mud guard.

figure.caption: Figure 30. Remove Hood- Bumper Mud Guards on 5500 i (SFA)

svcsubproc.title: Remove Mud Guards on 5600 i (SBA) with Tilt Hood
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 22 for all items in parentheses.

step1.para: With hood tilted open, remove five hex bolts with flat washers (Items 1, 2, 7 and 8) and five hex nuts with lock washers (Items 3, 4, 9 and 10) attaching mud guard (Item 24) and mud guard channel bracket (Item 25) to the chassis splash panel and mud guard mounting bracket (Item 6), driver side shown.
Repeat this procedure to remove passenger side mud guard.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Mud Guards on 5600 i (SBA) with Optional Butterfly Hood
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 31 for all items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove four hex bolts (Item 1) and four hex lock nuts (Item 2) and remove the mud guard and mud guard reinforcement (Items 3 and 4) from the mud guard mounting bracket (Item 5), driver side shown.

To remove mud guard mounting bracket (Item 5), remove three hex bolts with flat washers (Items 6 and 7) and three hex lock nuts (Item 8) that fasten it to the fender well support bracket and fender assembly (Items 9 and 10), driver side shown.
Repeat this procedure to remove passenger side mud guard and mud guard mounting bracket.

figure.caption: Figure 31. Remove Mud Guard on 5600 i (SBA) with Optional Butterfly Hood

svcsubproc.title: Remove Mud Guards on 5600 i (SBA) With Optional Butterfly Hood (8 X 4 and 8 X 6 with 65.5 and 72 inch Front Axle Spread)
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 32 for all items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove four hex bolts (Item 1) and four hex lock nuts (Item 2) and remove the mud guard and mud guard reinforcement (Items 3 and 4) from the mud guard mounting bracket (Item 5), driver side shown.

To remove mud guard mounting bracket (Item 5), remove three hex bolts with flat washers (Items 6 and 7) and three hex lock nuts (Item 8) that fasten it to the fender well support bracket and fender assembly (Items 9 and 10), driver side shown.
Repeat this procedure to remove passenger side mud guard and mud guard mounting bracket.

figure.caption: Figure 32. Remove Mud Guard on 5600 i (SBA) With Optional Butterfly Hood (8 X 4 and 8 X 6 with 65.5 and 72 inch Front Axle Spread)

svcsubproc.title: Remove Fuel Tank Mud Guard Shield on 9900 i (SFA) and 9900 ix (SFA)
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 33 for all items in parentheses.

note.para: Before removing fuel tank mud guard shield (Item 5) from the fuel tank step, mark the slot on the fuel tank step the mounting bolt is located through securing the fuel tank mud guard shield to the fuel tank step. This will help when installing a new or the original fuel tank mud guard shield back onto the vehicle.

step1.para: Remove hex bolt with fuel tank mud guard shield spacer (Items 1 and 2, view in direction of arrow A and circle C) and hex lock nut with flat washer (Items 3 and 4, view in direction of arrow A and circle C) attaching the fuel tank mud guard shield (Item 5, view in direction of arrow A and circle C) to the front of the fuel tank step (Item 6, view in direction of arrow A and circle C), driver side shown.

Remove hex bolt (Item 7, view in direction of arrow B) and hex lock nut with flat washer (Items 8 and 9, view in direction of arrow B) attaching the fuel tank mud guard shield (Item 10, view in direction of arrow B) to the fuel tank mounting bracket (Item 11, view in direction of arrow B), driver side shown.
Repeat this procedure to remove passenger side fuel tank mud guard shield.

figure.caption: Figure 33. Remove Fuel Tank Mud Guard shield on 9900 i (SFA) and 9900 ix (SFA)

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. FUEL TANK MUD GUARD SHIELD SPACER
